title: Desktop Support Analyst
description:
##### **Job Type: Contract**


##### **Job Category: IT**


#### **Job Description**


Job title: Desktop Support Analyst


Job Summary:


We are seeking a skilled Desktop Support Analyst to join our team and provide technical support to our employees. As a Desktop Support Analyst, you will be responsible for troubleshooting and resolving hardware and software issues, setting up new equipment, and providing training to users. You will play a crucial role in ensuring that our employees have the tools and resources they need to perform their jobs efficiently.


Responsibilities and Duties:

* Provide technical support to employees both in person and remotely
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware and software issues
* Install, configure, and maintain desktops, laptops, printers, and other equipment
* Set up new equipment for employees
* Provide training to users on software applications and technology best practices
* Document and track all support requests and resolutions
* Assist with IT projects and initiatives as needed


Qualifications and Skills:

* 2+ years of experience in desktop support or a related field
* Proficiency in Windows operating systems and Microsoft Office Suite
* Knowledge of computer hardware and software troubleshooting
* Strong communication and customer service skills
* Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks
* Certifications such as CompTIA A+ or Microsoft Certified Desktop Support Technician (MCDST) are a plus


#DesktopSupportAnalyst #TechnicalSupport #Hardware #Software #Troubleshooting #ITSupport #ComputerHardware #CustomerService #MicrosoftOffice #CompTIA #MCDST #USJobs #ITJobs #TechJobs #DesktopSupport #RemoteSupport.


##### **Required Skills**


Data Analyst

title: Medical Receptionist/ Patient Relations Representative
description:
**New York Plastic Surgical Group is seeking a Full-Time Medical Receptionist/Patient Relations Representative to join our practice!**

  


**Spanish speaking is a plus!**

  


**Why Choose New York Plastic Surgical Group:**


* Annual bonuses based on performance evaluation.
* Medical, dental, vision, and pet insurance
* 19 Days PTO, as well as 8 paid holidays
* 401k-4% Company Match
* Deep Blue Med Spa Employee Benefits Program (50% product discount, complimentary and discounted services, including injectables, etc.)
* Educational Development/Tuition Reimbursement
* Wellness programs (Employee Assistance Program and discounted gym memberships)
* Discounted wireless phone services through Verizon.
* Discounts through PLUM and Work Advantage

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO PERFORMING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:**


* Answer telephone calls and make various appointments, courteously and efficiently.
* Further develop and maintain a full understanding of all NYPSG doctor preferences and procedures.
* Ensure “new patient” online registration including patient histories and demographics is done in a timely manner prior to scheduled appointments.
* Develop and maintain knowledge of medical insurance.
* Obtain insurance information on all reconstructive consults prior to their initial visit.
* Maintain and further develop knowledge of the payment process (how to create a bill, how to add/apply a payment, etc.).

  


**Qualifications:**


* Undergraduate/business school degrees preferred or 2+ years of relevant experience.
* Knowledge of medical terminology preferred
* Strong computer/technical skills, including knowledge of practice management software (NexTech, a plus) and Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Word)
* Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

  


**Compensation: $19.00-$21.00**

  


**ABOUT US:**



New York Plastic Surgical Group, a division of Long Island Plastic Surgical Group, is the largest, longest-running academic plastic surgery group in the nation. Established in 1948, our practice has treated over half a million patients and developed many of the region's specialty centers including microsurgery, burn surgery, wound care, facial reanimation, peripheral nerve reconstruction, and cleft care. With 20+ surgeons and 10+ locations, we are proud to provide patients with over 75 years of medical innovation.



In addition to offering a full spectrum of plastic surgery and injectable services to our patients, we are also committed to supporting our community by meeting the need for reconstructive care. Each year our practice hosts an annual Breast Cancer Summit to provide an overview of the latest developments in breast cancer care and reconstruction.



Beyond our work locally we are also proud to partner with ReSurge International to bring our expertise in limb reattachment, complex wound and burn management, reconstructive cleft lip and palate repair, and other life-altering surgeries to underserved communities worldwide.



When it comes to aesthetics, our surgeons are proud to oversee Deep Blue Med Spa, a comprehensive medical spa designed to provide patients with non-surgical aesthetic options clinically proven to rejuvenate, restore, and refresh. From relaxing and results-driven facials to laser treatments and skin tightening, our highly skilled physician assistants, nurse practitioners, and medical aestheticians offer services customized to meet the needs of every patient. We also offer several medical-grade skincare brands including our signature line: ProBLUEMD®.
company_addresses: Located in Garden City, Babylon, East Hills, Huntington, Brooklyn, Flushing and NYC.
company_description: New York Plastic Surgical Group is dedicated to providing compassionate and comprehensive care to its patients through the collective medical expertise of its surgeons.

title: Web Operations Lead
description:
**Company Overview:** 

Website: https://www.orolay.com/

**OROLAY. MADE TO ROAM.**

*Original, Refined, Open, Luxe, Aspiring, Youthful*

**Our Story** 

Orolay’s journey began in 2012 with a group of passionate and innovative fashion experts who were inspired by the boundless energy and potential of the metropolitan lifestyle.Understanding the strength, style, and originality of our ambitious audience, we took a disruptive stride into the global market with our headline stealing down puffer in 2018. Coveted and attained by millions, our 092 design found its way out into streets and sidewalks across the world. By making chic and timeless fashion widely available, we proved that luxury style can be accessible, inclusive, and immensely functional. From that seminal coat to a complete and growing collection, our apparel is designed to accompany and empower. Refined, desirable, and durable, our pieces are enduring companions that put a touch of elegance into every step of their owner’s nonstop pursuits.As a global fashion brand, we will never stop designing pieces that help people explore and express themselves everywhere they roam.

**Our Value**

Inclusivity: Like our vibrant city, we are open to all.We welcome people of all backgrounds, genders, and sizes to share in our story and journey.

Expression: We aim to inspire people to embrace their style and to share their truth confidently. We believe the more we explore and express ourselves, the more we explore and share with the world.

Quality: We make our products to match the strength and character of the people who wear them. With attention to the beauty of details and the necessities of function, our pieces offer the comfort and certainty of a reliable companion everywhere they go.

Freedom: We believe that fashion can enable people to roam further as they take on the world, so we aim to empower people’s journeys as they face the elements of weather and life alike.

**Brand Personality** 

Confidence: We have certainty about who we are, what we’re worth, and what we’re capable of.

Ambitious: We strive to deliver the most value and quality into our pieces and aren’t afraid to disrupt the global industry.

Original: We have a unique perspective on the role of fashion in people’s lives and express it with authenticity and flair.

Welcoming: We make all people feel like they can wear our clothing and interact with our brand through genuine accessibility and thoughtful representation.

**Job Summary:**

As the Orolay NY INC. Web Operations Lead you will be responsible for developing and executing the company's online sales and brand promotion strategies, managing the day-to-day operations and maintenance of the independent site to achieve sales goals and enhance user experience.

**Job description:**

*Duties/Responsibilities:*

* Develop and execute sales and promotional strategies for the Orolay independent site to ensure the achievement of sales targets.
* Manage the day-to-day operations of the independent site, including product listing, pricing management, and event planning.
* Manage website content to ensure accuracy, completeness, and attractiveness.
* Responsible for optimizing the user experience of the independent site, including website functionality, page design, and user feedback.
* Coordinate internal teams, including technology, design, and customer service departments, to ensure smooth operation of the independent site.
* Analyze sales data and user behavior, propose improvement suggestions, and continuously optimize the operation of the independent site.
* Manage customer service work for the independent site to ensure timely resolution of customer issues and improve customer satisfaction.
* Track industry trends and competitors' situations, and formulate corresponding strategies.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor's degree or above, preferably in marketing, e-commerce, or related fields.
* Three or more years of experience in e-commerce operations management, with a track record of success preferred.
* Deep understanding of the internet industry and familiarity with various aspects of e-commerce operations.
* Excellent communication and teamwork skills, able to effectively coordinate departmental resources.
* Strong data analysis skills and problem-solving abilities.
* Strong ability to handle pressure and execute tasks, able to cope with complex operational environments.
* Strong interest in fashion brands and brand marketing preferred.

Other Requirements:

* Capability to work extended periods seated at a desk using a computer.
* Availability for occasional participation in conference calls with international teams.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Front-end development: 5 years (Preferred)
* CSS: 5 years (Preferred)
* Shopify: 4 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Manhattan, NY 10018 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Manhattan, NY 10018: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Staff Recruiting Specialist
description:
The Staff Recruiting Specialist serves as an ambassador for the firm supporting the firm’s staff recruiting process, as well as key initiatives that enable the firm to attract a diverse group of qualified candidates and provide a consistent, exceptional experience for candidates and key stakeholders. A hybrid work schedule is available for this position.

A career at Nixon Peabody is the opportunity to do work that matters. It’s the chance to use your knowledge to shape what’s ahead. To share, to innovate, to learn at a firm that taps the power of collective thinking.

We’ve created a dynamic, energizing environment that promotes success for our clients and each other. We offer fast growth, connectedness and training in business as well as law. And our rigorous standards assure you are part of a diverse team of top talent at every turn.

If you’re someone who’s looking toward the future, we’d love to hear from you.

**Location:** Albany, NY; Boston, MA; Buffalo, NY; Chicago, IL; Manchester, NH; Melville, NY; New York City, NY; Providence, RI; Rochester, NY; Washington, DC

* Work with Staff Recruiting Manager to develop and implement strategic recruiting goals and department initiatives, including diversity recruiting roles supporting the firm’s objectives.
* Partner with hiring managers to understand job requirements and competencies, evaluating and identifying staffing strategies to develop diverse pools of qualified candidates.
* Proactively source candidates through a variety of channels, review applications, and conduct initial phone screens.
* Schedule interviews, collect evaluation feedback forms, distribute feedback summaries to relevant parties, and coordinate travel arrangements, as applicable.
* Maintain staff candidate information, job requisitions, recruiting activity, and other relevant recruiting information in the firm’s applicant tracking system.
* Identify and secure hiring approval from functional leadership and perform relevant pre-search due diligence.
* Provide frequent ongoing communications to hiring manager, the Staff Recruiting Manager, and relevant HR team members.
* Develop and maintain internal and external postings for open staff roles; work with HR colleagues to ensure accuracy of job descriptions and pay ranges.
* Consult with hiring managers, the Staff Recruiting Manager, and HR staff in the final selection of qualified candidates to meet the firm’s needs.
* Participate in salary recommendations, as well as preparing and extending offers.
* Initiate and perform required post-offer due diligence, including professional reference checks, background checks, past employment verification, and conflicts clearance.
* Liaise with and assist regional HR with first-class onboarding experience.
* Prepare reports, projections, and statistics regarding staff hiring.
* Liaise with search firms and temporary recruiting agencies and negotiate placement agreements. Coordinate and track all staff agency agreements.
* Perform other tasks as required.

*To perform this job successfully, you must be able to perform each essential job responsibility listed above, satisfactorily, with or without reasonable accommodation. Nixon Peabody retains the right to change or assign other duties to this position. The requirements listed below are representative of the skills and abilities required.*

**Job Requirements:**

* Minimum of 3-5 years of talent acquisition experience, preferably in a law firm or other professional services environment.
* Bachelor's degree preferred; work experience in lieu of degree will be considered.
* Strong organizational and project management skills with ability to work in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple priorities and competing demands.
* Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Client-driven team player with exceptional client service skills and attention to detail; must be extremely responsive to both internal and external clients.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook required; prior experience with document management systems preferred.
* Prior experience with applicant tracking systems, such as LawCruit, strongly preferred.
* Ability to work independently as well as part of a team, interacting with all levels of firm personnel.
* Demonstrated professionalism and the highest regard for confidentiality.
* Self-starter with ability to remain self-directed and self-motivated with minimal supervision.
* Demonstrated creativity, initiative, enthusiasm, and good judgment.
* Ability to learn quickly and apply training to practical issues.
* Flexibility to work outside of normal business hours.

*In accordance with applicable Federal and State laws, the anticipated annual salary range for this position, depending on location, is as follows:*

* *Rochester, NY: $58,172 to $83,210*
* *Buffalo, NY: $58,172 to $83,210*
* *Manchester, NH: $58,172 to $83,210*
* *Albany, NY: $61,081 to $87,370*
* *Providence, RI: $63,989 to $91,530*
* *Chicago, IL: $66,898 to $95,691*
* *Washington, DC: $69,807 to $99,851*
* *Boston, MA: $69,807 to $99,851*
* *Los Angeles, CA: $69,807 to $99,851*
* *San Francisco, CA: $72,715 to $104,012*
* *New York, NY: 72,715 to $104,012*
* *Long Island, NY: 72,715 to $104,012*

*In addition to a standard benefits package, this role may be eligible for additional contingent compensation based on an array of factors, including but not limited to: work performance, geographic location, work experience, education, and qualifications. Because such contingent compensation is not yet calculable or may be zero ($0) in some circumstances, the above-listed salary range(s) are Nixon Peabody’s good faith estimate of the annual salary(ies) it reasonably expects to pay for the position at the time of this posting.* 

*Nixon Peabody LLP is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer: Disability / Female / Gender Identity / Minority / Sexual Orientation / Veteran. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.* 

*To comply with Federal law, Nixon Peabody participates in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are verified through this electronic system established by the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) and the Social Security Administration (SSA) to confirm their identity and employment eligibility. Please refer to the Notice of E-Verify Participation and the Right to Work posters on the Nixon Peabody Careers page for more information.*

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY

title: Executive Director, Event Strategist & Lead
description:
**Job Description:**  

  

**About ETS:**  

For more than 75 years, we have amplified products and services based rigorous research and our belief in the power of learning. Driven by our mission to advance quality and equity in education, ETS provides learning solutions, pioneering research and trusted assessments that help guide learners around the world on their path to new possibilities.


Our portfolio of trusted measures include **TOEFL®, TOEIC®, GRE® and Praxis®**. Along with research, development and innovation that explores new frontiers in learning and measurement our educational measurement solutions and research contribute to the development of new methods and tools, inform important dialogue with education policymakers, and shed light on critical issues and potential solutions - all with the aim of creating a world where all learners can improve their lives through education.


With new senior leadership at the helm, ETS aims to continue changing the lives of all learners as we expand our organization's global footprint. Our goal is to remain at the forefront of assessment and measurement efficacy within the education and ed tech space as it continues to grow and evolve.

  

The Lead Event Strategist will be responsible for leading the event strategy and execution in the Global Marketing & Innovation organization. This role will own and lead the global corporate events strategy, strategic planning process, conference and event prioritization, event ROI measurement (fueling the virtuous cycle), corporate events budget overview, and growing leadgen capture at events.  

This role will lead a small, specialized events team to fully execute events and conferences with excellence. It will lead a variety of cross-division, multifunctional teams ensuring constant alignment of key stakeholders ultimately keeping the CMIO, CEO and key company leaders updated at regular intervals. The role has two direct reports. Travel expected 10–20%.


RESPONSIBILITIES


* Leads and develops event strategy and experience design, event marketing communications, audience acquisition, demand generation, global field enablement and engagement, and integrated campaign alignment
* Supports the creation of event experiences across business groups with an audience-first perspective and event attendee journeys from pre-event to post-event
* Oversees management and tracking of all company-wide events/conferences at which ETS has/should have a presence
* Partners with Communications Team and business partners to develop impactful agendas with respect to keynotes, speakers for panels, and engaging activations on event tech and digital, customer marketing, integrated marketing, leadgen
* Partners with Marketing on event tech and digital, customer marketing, integrated marketing, leadgen
* Aids in the development, coordination and implementation of marketing assets across our business units
* Assists with global event reporting including post-event surveys, measurement recaps, ROI analysis and more; makes recommendations on new event/conference opportunities at which ETS should have a presence.
* Travel to select events as needed. This may include weekend and evening hours.
* Adhere to ethical standards and comply with the laws and regulations applicable to your job function.

SKILLS


* Industry experience required
* Skilled at cultivating relationships with internal and external partners and cross functional teams
* Proven ability working in a fast-paced environment managing multiple collaborators and concurrent programs
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience communicating with C-suite leaders
* Experience working with or supporting programs that support sales and drive pipeline
* High level of organizational and project management skills
* Adept at multitasking under pressure, with the ability to prioritize and handle a variety of projects simultaneously
* Strong work ethic is a requirement
* Ability to take initiative in problem solving and decision-making
* Success with achieving goals and OKRs

**Experience and Skills:**
EDUCATION


Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education, training, and experience required


EXPERIENCE


10+ years of experience in event strategy, event marketing communications or similar role


#LI-NK1


#LI-HYBRID


**ETS believes in a Total Rewards philosophy for our employees, and they include:**

* Health, Vision, Dental insurance plans to choose from
* Generous continuous learning support, from individual learning grants to up to 6 classes a year for tuition reimbursement as well as on-line learning access!
* Generous PTO and vacation time to balance your work and life
* Additional 8 hours of PTO for volunteer work
* Retirement plan (401(a)) and traditional Roth (403b) with company contribution
* Commuter Benefits, Pet Insurance, 1 year subscription to Calm App

**ETS is mission driven and action oriented**

* Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging is at the forefront of the ETS employee's daily work. To further foster an inclusive environment ETS is home to a wide variety of Affinity groups that celebrate the diversity of our talented employees.
* How about cultivating growth, innovation, and continuous transformation for the next generation of rising professionals as leaders? ETS offers multiple Business Resource Groups (BRG) for you!
* Are you passionate about volunteering and being active in your career and community? ETS offers our Center for Advocacy & Philanthropy (CAAP) where we encourage ETS employees to become active volunteers in their communities and schools through the ETS Cares Giving Campaign. Our employees can support any 501c3 or eligible charity of their choice.

**ETS is an Equal Opportunity Employer comprised of people with different experiences, strengths, and backgrounds who share a passion for advancing quality and equity in education. We are dedicated to building teams that reflect the various backgrounds, experiences, and identities of those we serve. The Talent Acquisition team strives to ensure candidates enjoy a fair and equitable hiring process. We believe our differences empower us to be a better team, making better decisions and delivering better results.**

title: HR Business Partner
description:
**Job Description:** **About ETS:**


For more than 75 years, we have amplified products and services based rigorous research and our belief in the power of learning. Driven by our mission to advance quality and equity in education, ETS provides learning solutions, pioneering research and trusted assessments that help guide learners around the world on their path to new possibilities.


Our portfolio of trusted measures include **TOEFL®, TOEIC®, GRE® and Praxis®**. Along with research, development and innovation that explores new frontiers in learning and measurement our educational measurement solutions and research contribute to the development of new methods and tools, inform important dialogue with education policymakers, and shed light on critical issues and potential solutions - all with the aim of creating a world where all learners can improve their lives through education.


With new senior leadership at the helm, ETS aims to continue changing the lives of all learners as we expand our organization's global footprint. Our goal is to remain at the forefront of assessment and measurement efficacy within the education and ed tech space as it continues to grow and evolve.


POSITION SUMMARY


The HR Business Partner plays a pivotal role in developing and executing the HR strategy tailored to support the division's strategic objectives.


This role partners with divisional leader(s) to define and build organizational capabilities to drive business results aligned to the overall ETS strategy and priorities.


They collaborate closely with HR shared services to ensure alignment with overall organizational goals and objectives while addressing specific needs of each division. The incumbent will be responsible for managing recruitment, training & development, performance management, day-to-day HR operations, and handling employee relations issues. The incumbent will work closely with all levels of management and employees to support and promote the division’s business goals while ensuring compliance with employment laws and regulations.


PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES


* Advise and influence business leaders on organizational design, employee engagement & retention, leadership development, performance criteria and measurement, succession planning, and change management in support of achieving ETS’s mission and divisional objectives.
* Help drive the business unit’s people strategy, organizational design, leadership development and change management to scale for growth.
* Provide overall HR support to the organization, ensuring alignment and consistency where appropriate.
* In partnership with Talent Acquisition, develop and implement recruitment strategies to attract top talent; coordinate job postings, review resumes, & conduct interviews; an facilitate the hiring process from job posting to onboarding.
* Partner with and provide input to Corporate HR on compensation/benefits and HRIS shared services.
* Develop strategies to enhance employer branding and employee value proposition.
* Works closely with management and employees to improve work relationships, build morale, and increase productivity and retention.
* Foster organizational effectiveness through analytics, establishing and tracking metrics, KPIs, and automation that drive business decision support.
* Partner with the divisional leadership team and HR colleagues to drive cultural shifts and employee engagement needed to achieve key priorities and continuously refine the strategy to improve the employee culture through the right mix of communications and experiences.
* Serve as a point of contact for employee inquiries & concerns, mediate conflicts & provide guidance on employee relations issues, and conduct investigations and resolve workplace disputes.
* Identify and implement opportunities within HR for greater efficiency, effectiveness, agility, and standardization that is consistent with the business strategy.
* Provide training and support to managers on performance management processes and identify areas for improvement and implement performance development plans.
* Continuously improve the quality of the overall human capital by attracting and promoting the best talent and building strong overall succession pipelines and working collaboratively with leaders to understand staffing requirements and ensure the workforce meets current and future needs.
* Leverage HR best practices, and when appropriate, adapt to reflect unique business needs and share them with HR colleagues.

  

**Experience and Skills:****KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS**

* In-depth knowledge of HR practices, labor laws, and regulations in the business unit’s region
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information
* Strong organizational and problem-solving skills
* A deep understanding of the business to effectively address challenges and facilitate smooth HR processes
* Proficiency in HRIS (Human Resources Information


#LI-RD1


#LI-HYBRID


**EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE**

* Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
* Master's degree preferred
* 6+ years of experience in Human Resources roles, with progressively increasing responsibilities
* Previous experience in a global leadership role managing HR functions across multiple geographies
* Proven track record and of developing and implementing HR strategies aligned with revenue growth goals in fast-paced and high-performing environments
* Professional certifications such as SPHR, SHRM-SCP, or equivalent are a plus

**ETS believes in a Total Rewards philosophy for our employees, and they include:**

* Health, Vision, Dental insurance plans to choose from
* Generous continuous learning support, from individual learning grants to up to 6 classes a year for tuition reimbursement as well as on-line learning access!
* Generous PTO and vacation time to balance your work and life
* Additional 8 hours of PTO for volunteer work
* Retirement plan (401(a)) and traditional Roth (403b) with company contribution
* Commuter Benefits, Pet Insurance, 1 year subscription to Calm App

**ETS is mission driven and action oriented**

* Diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging is at the forefront of the ETS employee's daily work. To further foster an inclusive environment ETS is home to a wide variety of Affinity groups that celebrate the diversity of our talented employees.
* How about cultivating growth, innovation, and continuous transformation for the next generation of rising professionals as leaders? ETS offers multiple Business Resource Groups (BRG) for you!
* Are you passionate about volunteering and being active in your career and community? ETS offers our Center for Advocacy & Philanthropy (CAAP) where we encourage ETS employees to become active volunteers in their communities and schools through the ETS Cares Giving Campaign. Our employees can support any 501c3 or eligible charity of their choice.

**ETS is an Equal Opportunity Employer comprised of people with different experiences, strengths, and backgrounds who share a passion for advancing quality and equity in education. We are dedicated to building teams that reflect the various backgrounds, experiences, and identities of those we serve. The Talent Acquisition team strives to ensure candidates enjoy a fair and equitable hiring process. We believe our differences empower us to be a better team, making better decisions and delivering better results.**

title: Medical Assistant/Surgical Assistant
description:
Medical Assistant-**Per Diem / As Needed May Go Fulltime**

Description: **Experienced in sterile procedures/Plastics/Endo**

This is a Per Diem / As needed, weekday, day-shift position(730-330). We are seeking a Medical Assistant preferably with ***scrub-in experience*** to join our clinical team.

We invite you to contact us in regard to a position as a Medical Assistant with Westchester Surgical Specialist/Columbia University located in Bronxville, New York.

In this position you will prepare patients and procedure rooms for vascular procedures, arranges instruments for the interventional procedure, maintains sterile techniques within the sterile field, and cleans the procedure room after each case.

Responsibilities

Scrubbing responsibilities with Multiple surgeons.  
Assist clinical team with patient and procedure room preparation and post-procedure clean-up  
Prepare patients for vascular access procedure including but not limited to positioning patients on procedure room table  
Gather, arrange, prepare instruments before procedures; remove afterward; ensure sterilization of instruments  
Monitor all members of the clinical team to maintain a sterile field during procedures  
Transport patients to and from the procedure room  
Operate diagnostic equipment and sterilizing equipment  
Ensure assigned areas are clean and stocked for future procedures

Other duties and responsibilities as assigned including but not limited to:  
Work overtime with little or no notice as needed  
Attend team meetings, phone conferences, and training as needed  
Know, understand, and follow teammate guidelines, employment policies, and department or company procedures

Qualifications  
High school diploma or equivalent required  
Basic Life Support (BLS) certification required  
Basic computer skills and proficiency in MS Word and Outlook required

title: FP&A Manager
description:
Isolatek is searching for an experienced FP&A Manager located in Netcong, NJ. As the FP&A Manager, you will support the CFO, Controller, and Sales teams. This role is critical in ensuring accurate and timely financial reporting, comprehensive analysis, budgeting, and forecasting. The ideal candidate will be adept in using Microsoft Power BI to create robust and insightful reports. As the sole FP&A role within the company, the individual must be a self-starter capable of working independently and effectively communicating with various departments.  

  

**As the FP&A Manager you will:**  

* Assist the Controller with the preparation of monthly financial reports, providing insights and analysis.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive customer and product profitability reports, addressing any issues with proposed corrective actions.
* Perform data analytics, financial modeling, and industry/business analysis to support decision-making.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to evaluate trends and provide analytical solutions.
* Prepare and analyze 13-week cash flow including identification and highlighting to the CFO potential cash shortfall/surplus or other needs critical to the business.
* Integrate required analyses into monthly board reporting packages, identifying and addressing meaningful trends and outliers.
* Track and monitor cost-saving initiatives in accordance with the Company operating plan.
* Assist with the preparation and review of Capital Appropriation Requests, ensuring proper recording of new purchases and disposals.
* Support the CFO and department heads in the preparation of the annual budget and year-over-year analysis, guiding departments on their submissions.
* Prepare ad hoc reports and perform various financial analyses as required.
* Maintain accurate and complete records in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practices.
* Promote a safe, orderly, and clean department environment.
* Communicate and coordinate effectively with other departments to ensure total customer satisfaction.


* **To be successful in the role you must possess:**
* BS in Accounting, Finance, or related field
* 7 - 10 years of experience in FP&A roles, preferably in a manufacturing environment.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Power BI, Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, and Adobe Pro.
* 3+ years of active experience with Oracle EBS or 5+ years with professional ERP systems.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Technical accounting knowledge.
* Ability to work independently and perform well in a team environment.
* Strong organizational skills with the ability to meet deadlines accurately.

  

Isolatek International was established in 1875 as a manufacturer of mineral wool and today is a global leader in the development, manufacture, and distribution of proprietary Passive Fire Resistive Materials for steel-protecting commercial, industrial, petrochemical, and tunnel projects. We have taken passive fireproofing technology to a new level with our global expansion supported by 5 licensee manufacturing operations outside the Americas which complement our 5 manufacturing operations in the Americas.  

If you are ready to work with a growing organization that values safety, integrity, and continuous improvement, please apply today!

title: Med Tech
description:
**Job Title:** Med Tech, Full-Time  

  

**Job Description:**  

  

**We’re hiring a full-time Med Tech to join our team at Penn Medicine Princeton Health in Plainsboro, NJ! This exciting opportunity comes with a $10,000 sign-on bonus.**  

  

Are you looking for a fulfilling career in healthcare? Join us at Princeton Health as a Med Tech and plan an active role in delivering on the promise of a healthier future. As a Medical Technician, you will be responsible for performing complex study procedures within the clinical section assigned.  

  

**About** **the Princeton Health Team****:**  

Delivering on our mission to advance the health of our communities begins with a foundation of inclusion, compassion, and respect for our patients and each other. As a member of our team, you can expect to:* Work in an inclusive environment
* Collaborate with leading healthcare professionals as part of Penn Medicine, a world-renowned, academic medical center
* Have access to growth and development opportunities to take your career to the next level

  

**Med Tech Job Responsibilities:*** Performs and interprets basic and advanced technical procedures on blood samples and completes required quality control
* Maintains equipment, reagents and other supplies to assure the quality and accuracy of test procedures. Perform preventive maintenance and performance checks on departmental equipment
* Knows and helps oversee compliance with applicable federal and state laws
* Assumes complete responsibility for the accuracy of study results.

  

**Med Tech Job Requirements:*** Bachelor’s degree in chemical, biological or laboratory science/medical technology science required
* Recent experience in a laboratory setting
* MT (ASCP or NCA), MLS (ASCP), or previously qualified as Medical Technologist prior to 2/28/92 under 42CFR493.1427 (3/14/90)
* Proven ability to work with related complex automated instrumentation
* Required to function with complex automated instrumentation and report results in writing and by telephone.

  

**Our Benefits at a Glance:**  

At Penn Medicine, we believe the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. We are committed to providing professional and educational growth opportunities in a world-class organization with a history of stability, growth, and innovation. At Princeton Health, this includes:* Tuition assistance paid directly to the institution: $8,000 for full-time staff and $4,000 for part-time staff
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending Account, Life Insurance, 403b, Pet Insurance and more available on start date.
* Pharmacy discounts for staff and family members filled at Princeton Health pharmacy.
* Employee Benevolent Fund that provides financial support to employees in times of unusual needs.
* Free parking.

  

**Don’t miss this opportunity to live your life’s work. Apply today.**  

  

We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, marital status, familial status, genetic information, domestic or sexual violence victim status, citizenship status, military status, status as a protected veteran or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Registered OR Nurse
description:
**Job Title:** Registered OR Nurse, Full-Time  

  

**Job Description:**  

  

**We’re hiring a full-time Registered OR Nurse to join our team at Penn Medicine Princeton Health in Monroe, NJ! This exciting opportunity comes with a Monday – Friday, 7:00 am to 3:30 pm schedule with no nights, holidays, weekend or on-call requirements.**  

  

Are you looking for a fulfilling career in healthcare? Join us at Princeton Health as a Registered OR Nurse and plan an active role in delivering on the promise of a healthier future. title: Stock Lead I
description:
Stuart Weitzman shoes are designed for high fashion and high function. Known for over 35 years for it's artisanal Spanish craftsmanship and precisely-engineered fit, the luxury footwear brand inspires women around the world to shine with confidence with every step.


Stuart Weitzman is part of the Tapestry portfolio – a global house of brands committed to stretching what’s possible.


A member of the Tapestry family, we are part of a global house of brands that has unwavering optimism and is committed to being innovative and wholly inclusive. Visit **Our People** page to learn more about Tapestry's commitment to equity, inclusion, and diversity.


**Job Title: Stock Lead, North American Retail**

  


**Primary Purpose:** Supports the customer experience and leads operational standards to assist in achieving store’s sales plan.

  


**The successful individual will leverage their proficiency in leading operations****to...**

* Exhibit the competencies listed below with a focus on Drive for Results, Customer Focus & Learning on the Fly.
* Help the store achieve sales plan and KPI goals.
* Deliver a bold & energetic customer experience.
* Complete daily operational tasks including shipment, stockroom organization, order fulfillment, inventory management including SKU integrity and bringing/returning product to sales floor.
* Achieve Store Audit Scores at or above Stuart Weitzman’s Standard of 90%+.
* Manage evolving daily workload while prioritizing the customer experience.
* Ensure Stuart Weitzman’s Visual Guidelines are properly executed and maintained at all times.
* Understand, comply, and enforce company policies and procedures with a focus on loss prevention and audit compliance to protect the company’s inventory and assets.
* Ensure a safe, clean, and compliant environment at all times.
* Train and mentor store team on all operational tasks.
* Be a brand ambassador of Stuart Weitzman.

  




**The accomplished individual will possess:**


* Strong communication skills both oral and written.
* Excellent organization and attention to detail.
* Knowledge of POS, Microsoft office, and basic computer skills (including iPads, Internet, Mobile POS).

  




**The accomplished individual must have:**


* Ability to multi-task and execute at a fast pace.
* Ability to frequently lift and carry product/cartons up to 50 pounds to process product shipment/transfers.
* Ability to frequently lift and carry up to 25 pounds and, at times, lift and carry product/cartons up to 50 pounds to process product shipment/transfers.
* Ability to meet SW Scheduling & Availability Expectations, including ability to work a flexible schedule, including nights, weekends, and holidays.
  


**An outstanding professional will have:**


* 1-2 years of leadership experience in a retail environment preferred.
* High School diploma or equivalent work experience preferred.

  




***Note: This document serves only as a sample of job duties and responsibilities and does not include an exhaustive list of all performance requirements.***


**Our Competencies for All Employees**


* **Courage**: Doesn’t hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and “actionable” positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.
* **Creativity**: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
* **Customer Focus:** Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
* **Dealing with Ambiguity**: Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.
* **Drive for Results:** Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
* **Interpersonal Savvy**: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.
* **Learning on the Fly:** Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.


**Our Competencies for All People Managers**


* **Strategic Agility**: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.
* **Developing Direct Reports and Others:** Provides challenging and stretching tasks and assignments; holds frequent development discussions; is aware of each person's career goals; constructs compelling development plans and executes them; pushes people to accept developmental moves; will take on those who need help and further development; cooperates with the developmental system in the organization; is a people builder.
* **Building Effective Teams**: Blends people into teams when needed; creates strong morale and spirit in their team; shares wins and successes; fosters open dialogue; lets people finish and be responsible for their work; defines success in terms of the whole team; creates a feeling of belonging in the team.


Stuart Weitzman is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and we pride ourselves on hiring and developing the best people. All employment decisions (including recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, transfer, training, discipline and termination) are based on the applicant’s or employee’s qualifications as they relate to the requirements of the position under consideration. These decisions are made without regard to age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic characteristics, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, national origin, alienage, citizenship, disability, marital status, military status, pregnancy, or any other legally-recognized protected basis prohibited by applicable law.

  


**Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)**  

Tapestry, Inc. will provide applicants and employees with reasonable accommodation for disabilities or religious beliefs. If you require reasonable accommodation to complete the application process, please contact Tapestry People Services at 1-855-566-9264 or employeerelations@tapestry.com

  


Visit Stuart Weitzman at www.stuartweitzman.com.

  


**BASE PAY RANGE $20.00 TO $27.50 HOURLY**

title: Director, US Comirnaty Brand Access
description:
ROLE SUMMARY
Pfizer and BioNTech’s COVID vaccine (COMIRNATY) is FDA approved in the U.S for ages 12+ and transitioning from Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) to commercial launch for other age groups. The U.S. launch during each peak vaccine season is critical to the future success of our Vaccines BU.
Reporting to the Sr. Director, Comirnaty Performance and Access Lead, this individual will lead US market access strategy development. This includes developing and recommending strategies for payer launch planning and readiness across US payers. This also includes developing a comprehensive approach to how the brand should be positioned and represented as part of the US Vaccines portfolio.
This candidate will coordinate closely with critical partners from US Vaccines organizations including the US Adult, Pediatric and Adolescent marketing teams and Trade teams for ensuring brand initiatives are coordinated among the brand teams with a customer centric view and vaccines portfolio opportunities are fully leveraged. The candidate will work in an integrated way with the US Vaccines Market Access organization and Vaccine Account Management Team driving portfolio access and contracting strategies, initiatives, payer engagement, and communications to align on payer messaging, reimbursement solutions, and other customer facing services that are implemented across the portfolio such as reminder recall or adherence programs.
Candidate will also work closely across functional teams (Patient & Health Impact, retail contracting & innovation marketing, account management, policy, corporate affairs, medical, BAI, etc.) to support US market preparation and seasonal launch execution, and will ensure all payer related milestones are developed, tracked, and achieved on time
ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES* Is accountable to develop payer strategies in close coordination and partnership with US vaccines market access team and also Vaccines Accounts team to ensure product access strategies, reimbursement solutions, other adherence initiatives and seasonal programs are well coordinated from a customer centric view in an effort to maximize our respiratory vaccines portfolio approach in the US market. This includes presenting our pricing strategy and supporting data to payers.
* Manage Access seasonal Launch Playbook to ensure critical path access deliverables are achieved to ensure launch readiness
* Accountable to design, develop and implement an immersive pharmacy experience that educates customers about mRNA vaccines, aids them in their decision-making process and provides additional resource with the ultimate goal of more customers opting for COVID vaccination
* Collaborate with mRNA Commercial Development, US Vaccines Market Access and Patient & Health Impact teams to develop US Payer access strategies and payer launch readiness plans for COVID vaccines
* Develop payer channel and customer insights to inform launch access strategies and annual operating plans
* Define critical processes and timelines across payer types to establish rapid access, coverage and reimbursement
* Develop payer segmentation and prioritization plans with defined customer engagement timelines
* Develop payer value proposition and associated messaging platform, to foster the prioritization and utilization of the late stage assets upon FDA approval
* Support channel optimization planning across retail channel including supporting in contract offer development & internal training.
* Develop & execute comprehensive Payer tactical plan to ensure appropriate promotion across channels and across in store, digital, and non-personal promotion including working with media lab across vaccine brands to maximize presence and in partnership with the consumer team to ensure strategies are coordinated.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* Bachelor’s degree and 10+ years of experience required, or Master's degree and 9+ years of experience, or Ph.D./PharmD and 7+ years of experience required
* Familiarity / experience in the US market is required
* Strong project management, coordination skills across large groups of cross-functional teams and country teams
* Demonstrated ability to hold others accountable
* Demonstrated collaboration and informal influencing skills
* Champion innovation, seek learnings from other brands and other industries to innovate and enhance launch plans
* Ability to prioritize, manage important versus urgent and complete what’s most important
* Be an active contributor to create and operate in an environment that continuously embraces and encourages the implementation of innovative ideas and fosters a culture of collaboration and teamwork


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* MBA or advanced degree preferred
* 5+ years pharma experience preferred
* Prior vaccines experience helpful, but not required
* Prior experience in the pharmacy, retail or employer space highly desirable
* Prior experience with US and/or global product launch excellence planning
* Simplicity advocate; actively uses simplicity principles in personal ways of working
* Comfortable with ambiguity and able to adapt and operate successfully


NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS* Some domestic travel may be required

  

Candidate demonstrates a breadth of diverse leadership experiences and capabilities including: the ability to influence and collaborate with peers, develop and coach others, oversee and guide the work of other colleagues to achieve meaningful outcomes and create business impact.  

Work Location Assignment: Flexible
LAST DAY TO APPLY: 08/19/2024
The annual base salary for this position ranges from $161,600.00 to $269,400.00. In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 20.0% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage. Learn more at Pfizer Candidate Site – U.S. Benefits | (uscandidates.mypfizerbenefits.com). Pfizer compensation structures and benefit packages are aligned based on the location of hire. The United States salary range provided does not apply to Tampa, FL or any location outside of the United States.
Relocation assistance may be available based on business needs and/or eligibility.
Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.
EEO & Employment Eligibility
Pfizer is committed to equal opportunity in the terms and conditions of employment for all employees and job applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, gender identity or gender expression, national origin, disability or veteran status. Pfizer also complies with all applicable national, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements of the Immigration and Nationality Act and IRCA. Pfizer is an E-Verify employer. This position requires permanent work authorization in the United States.

title: Associate Scientist– Viral Vaccines & Immunology
description:
Why Patients Need You
Pfizer’s purpose is to deliver breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Research and Development is at the heart of fulfilling Pfizer’s purpose as we work to translate advanced science and technologies into the therapies and vaccines that matter most. Whether you are in the discovery sciences, ensuring drug safety and efficacy or supporting clinical trials, you will apply cutting edge design and process development capabilities to accelerate and bring the best in class medicines to patients around the world.
What You Will Achieve
As an Associate Scientist, you will be at the center of our operations and you’ll find that everything we do, every day, is in line with an unwavering commitment to quality. You will have the important role to generate high-quality immunoassay data in a regulated Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) setting to support Pfizer’s vaccine programs according to Standard Operating Procedures. You will support the preclinical evaluation and early clinical development of mRNA and protein based viral vaccines. You will perform various assays to monitor the immune responses elicited by respiratory virus, herpesvirus, and influenza virus vaccine candidates. In addition, you will maintain cell lines and prepare preclinical and early clinical samples for testing. Your strong foundation in general scientific practice, its principles and concepts will help in meeting critical deadlines. Your strong work ethic and collaborative spirit will be an integral part of our dynamic team. You will be relied on as a technical contributor to assess the assigned tasks and make decisions that involve direct application of your knowledge.
It is your hard work and focus that will make Pfizer ready to achieve new milestones and help patients across the globe.
How You Will Achieve It* Perform preclinical serological bio-functional assays including, but not limited to neutralization assays, HAI, Luminex, and ELISAs.
* Generate and characterize reagents for preclinical bio-functional studies to support vaccine development.
* Perform data analysis and present critical data review of non-clinical data to colleagues and senior management.
* Organize assigned work according to established departmental priorities.
* Exercise and build team effectiveness skills {e.g., commitment, feedback, consensus management} within the immediate work group.
* Perform job responsibilities in compliance with current Good Manufacturing Practices/ Good Laboratory Practice (cGMP/GLP) and all other regulatory agency requirements.
* Assist in updating and writing documents associated with bio-functional assays, including information/data archiving and status reports.
* Assist in ordering supplies from internal inventory and external vendors.
* Interpret, summarize, and present progress on assay development and sample analysis to colleagues and senior management.
* Collect and analyze data on a per project basis to support troubleshooting, qualification and other lab projects.
* Stay current on all departmental and corporate training.


Qualifications
Must-Have* Bachelor's Degree with 0-2 years of laboratory experience in a relevant field of science
* Training in aseptic technique and cell culture
* Strong attention to detail and ability to collaborate and work in team environment
* The capacity to work effectively in a highly visible research program with time-constrained milestones.
* Good Computer skills including word processing, Excel, PowerPoint and relevant scientific software


Nice-to-Have* Pharmaceutical and biotech drug discovery experience
* Experience with handling infectious agents such as respiratory viruses
* Experience with adherent and non-adherent cell lines
* Knowledge of Luminex technology and flow cytometry techniques
* Experience in developing and troubleshooting bioassays designed to assess antibody functionality

  

Other Job Details:* Last Date to Apply for Job: August 15th, 2024
* Work Location Assignment: On Premise
On Premise colleagues work in a Pfizer site because it’s needed to get their job done. They may have flexibility to work remotely from time to time, but they are primarily on-site.

title: Innovative Program & Design Director - Oncology
description:
ROLE SUMMARY  

The Learning and Experience Innovation team partners closely with and leads across key stakeholders within Commercial Engagement training, across customer engagement BU teams, and external training vendors, associations, and innovative adult learning entities. The team works to cross-functionally lead and partner to develop and deliver best-in-class Customer Engagement Training.  

The team will define, develop, and deliver Customer Engagement Training processes, programs and ensure aligned curriculum design across training verticals to ensure training meets the needs of customer facing organizations. Efforts led and managed will include but may not be limited to the creation and execution of field faculty programs, customer-facing advisory councils and oversight into key existing and needed commercial engagement efforts where training is a key strategic and execution partner and driver with and for customer facing and leader teams. This will ensure training is effectively and efficiently embedded across needed customer facing business efforts and standard operating procedures so that training is supporting, leading and delivering the needed content and delivery design for world class experience and results.  

In addition to leading across the commercial customer facing teams, the Learning & Experience Innovation team will be the single-point of accountability owner of trainer development curriculum content and delivery for our Global Customer Engagement Training organization. This critical area of ownership will result in a world class train-the-trainer construct that crosses roles and topics, strengthens the capabilities of our Training organization, and delivers significant development opportunities and learnings across Training.  

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES* Serve as the primary Customer Engagement Training interface and partner to the customer facing platform and unit leads to help drive strategic priorities.
* Source, lead and manage the development, design, execution, and delivery of content, constructs, and process for Customer Engagement Training train-the-trainer curriculum.
* Define, develop, and deliver Customer Engagement Training processes and programs that meet the needs of the customer engagement platforms to include market, unique initiatives, and/or unit performance.
* Lead and connect end-to-end experience workflows, by roles and topics, to ensure a seamless integration across all verticals in the Customer Engagement Training organization – and ensure consistency for all customer facing platform builds.
* Define both short-term and long-term Training priorities for the customer engagement platform, in collaboration with customer facing leadership and other key stakeholders.
* Understand and leverage the priorities, strategies, structures, ways of working, sales and market analytics and trends, and technology platforms of the customer engagement platforms to help develop and evolve best-in-class Training.
* Build and lead strong cross-functional relationships with customer engagement partners to include Executive Leadership, Enablement, Marketing, Medical, Sales, Regulatory, and Legal teams to prioritize Training needs and manage demands.
* Collaborate with Customer Engagement Training LT and Subject Matter Experts to (1) ensure stakeholder alignment and strategic planning for end-to-end experiences and (2) identify, track, and evaluate metrics, results, key performance indicators for training productivity.
* Design and implement customer engagement platform growth and technical training initiatives to meet goals and support strategies.
* Collaborate across the Integrated Training team and other relevant stakeholders to determine suitable content for implementation in alignment with platform and customer engagement strategies.
* Coordinate with members of the Customer Engagement Training team to (1) support the development and execution of training and leadership development for the Customer Engagement Training organization (internal to the Training organization) and (2) deliver dynamic and core curriculum that will result in world-class trainer skills and capabilities across Training roles and leader levels.
* Contribute to Training’s Operating Plan development and execute aligned strategies and tactics.
* Assess tools to ensure fit-for-purpose and adoption where appropriate across Customer Engagement Training team.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* BA/BS degree or equivalent.
* 15+ years of enablement, account management, sales, marketing, training, or relevant Commercial experience.
* Demonstrated ability to align knowledge with customer engagement platform priorities, translate strategy into operational constructs, design and develop end-to-end experience workflows, and execute strategies seamlessly and in partnership with cross-functional stakeholders.
* Proven ability to lead, influence, train, and develop others across all levels – both leader lines and customer-facing colleagues.
* Proven people leadership experience in a matrix organization, direct and/or cross-functional, including leading people to meet goals and work together to achieve an objective, providing constructive feedback, and motivating employees.
* Demonstrated understanding and knowledge of the unique needs and ways of working of the Commercial customer engagement platforms, headquarters, specific go-to-market approaches, internal marketing/accounts/sales design, and other important cross-functional areas.
* Demonstrated expertise on the advanced marketplace, healthcare environment, collaborative approaches to customer engagement, and developing objectives and solutions.
* Executive presence and ability to influence senior stakeholders internally and externally.
* Strong interpersonal skills with a track record of building partnerships, interacting with stakeholders at varying levels, and building collaborative teams that work together across functions to meet aligned objectives.
* Outstanding presentation, facilitation, and writing skills.
* Ability to develop and deliver multi-modal communications that convey understandings of unique needs of different audiences.
* Project Management experience and organizational abilities to simultaneously manage multiple complex projects.
* Demonstrated creativity skills, with a track record of creating innovative ideas, developing new and better ways of working, and deploying innovative tools and technologies.
* Experience with data analysis of complex learning, sales and market related data from multiple sources to draw appropriate conclusions and help guide decision making.
* Ability to make sense of complex information to make sound judgment and decision making with minimal direction.
* Proven track record of holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
* Experience leading a diverse team to achieve common goals, leveraging diverse perspectives.
  

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Oncology experience
* Enablement experience
* Key Account Management experience
* Specific business unit experience
  

PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS  

NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
Travel is required for in-person meetings according to business needs  

OTHER INFORMATION* Last Date to Apply: August 12, 2024
* Work Location Assignment: United States-Remote
* Eligible for employee referral bonus

title: Customer Engagement Program Performance Manager - Oncology
description:
ROLE SUMMARY
The Customer Engagement Program Performance Manager – Oncology develops, tracks and analyzes key performance metrics and long-term impact outcomes for Customer Engagement Training programs to ensure learning effectiveness, program success and business impact. This role is responsible for outcome measurement and performance management for content delivery that span digital, on-demand, in-classroom and on-the job experience design to ensure optimal training approach, learner outcomes and brand/customer measures impact. The role manages training program effectiveness evaluation and conducts business and strategic training needs analysis to identify gaps and performance improvement opportunities. The role will work cross-functionally with needed business analytics and commercial effectiveness partners to understand and help shape, where appropriate, CFC analytics (core product and role budget goals, KPIs and customer loyalty measures). These measures are to be linked to needed training measures and guide priorities to ensure seamless business alignment with priorities, training scorecards and impact. Such measures will also be shared across Commercial Engagement Training in a consistent way to guide outcome-based scorecard communications, continuous improvement and operating plan.  

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES
In order of importance, indicate the primary responsibilities critical to the performance of the role. It is recommended not to list actual tasks but focus on 5-8 essential responsibilities that highlight accountability and level of judgment required.  

ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES* Define and align with key stakeholders on clear goals (metrics such as training effectiveness, value, and impact) for training program delivery, business impact and customer loyalty impact.
* Track and analyze core measures and metrics to understand effectiveness and impact of deployed training efforts to the learner and to business results, from both a customer and a business impact perspective, identifying and interpreting complex patterns and trends, and translating those insights into actionable recommendations.
* Manage the reporting and communication of performance and effectiveness of Customer Engagement Training programs with internal stakeholders in Customer Engagement Training and key business unit leaders to maintain strategic alignment with the strategic objectives and operating plan.
* Ensure consistent maintenance and optimization of data and data-quality, relevant to performance measurement.
* Ensure the development, sharing of and improvement of consistent core measures, KPIs and scorecards for training, globally and locally.
* Work on improvement of the performance measurement processes and the implementation of improvements.
* Gather best practices and share across needed multi-stakeholder groups and the Customer Engagement Training leadership to support an environment of teamwork and continuous improvement.
* Work with Customer Engagement Content Development Teams to fill training gaps and emerging needs
* Conduct regular reviews with Key Business Stakeholders to ensure the existing training programs meet business and strategic requirements, and get feedback on changes needed
* Provide advice to Customer Engagement Training LT as well as BU leaders on improvements to training curriculums, based on the attribution of performance measured.

QUALIFICATIONS  

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS* Bachelor’s degree required
* 8+ years of training, sales, performance management related experiences or combination of experiences
* Deep experience and knowledge of Program Performance Measurement and Management
* Deep experience with data collection, analysis and reporting of complex data from multiple sources to draw appropriate conclusions and make suitable recommendations to support strategic decision-making.
* Experience with Pfizer learning platforms
* Experience with business measures for brands and CFCs
* Previous experience leading people and matrixed organizations within commercial (i.e. sales, account management, marketing etc.) including developing people to meet goals, providing constructive feedback, and employee motivation.
* Executive presence and ability to influence senior stakeholders internally and externally
* Strong interpersonal skills with a track record of building partnership, interacting with stakeholders at varying levels, and working collaboratively across functions to meet share objectives
* Outstanding presentation, facilitation and writing skills
* Strong record of coaching teams to achieve personal and organizational goals
* Project Management experience and organizational abilities to simultaneously manage multiple complex projects
* Demonstrated creativity skills, with a track record of creating innovative ideas, develop new and better ways of working
* Ability to make sense of complex information to make sound judgment and decision making with minimal direction
* A track record of holding self and others accountable to meet commitments
* Experience leading a diverse team to achieve common goals, leveraging diverse perspectives.
* Ability to understand the business environment and objectives and develop solutions accordingly
  

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS* Oncology experience

OTHER INFORMATION* Last Date to Apply: August 19, 2024
* Work Location Assignment: 2.5 days a week in office in New York City -NY or Tampa, FL
* Eligible for employee referral bonus

The annual base salary for this position ranges from $117,300.00 to $195,500.00.\\* In addition, this position is eligible for participation in Pfizer’s Global Performance Plan with a bonus target of 17.5% of the base salary and eligibility to participate in our share based long term incentive program. We offer comprehensive and generous benefits and programs to help our colleagues lead healthy lives and to support each of life’s moments. Benefits offered include a 401(k) plan with Pfizer Matching Contributions and an additional Pfizer Retirement Savings Contribution, paid vacation, holiday and personal days, paid caregiver/parental and medical leave, and health benefits to include medical, prescription drug, dental and vision coverage.
